greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total number of factors in a factorization of n into Eisenstein primes.
comment: Equivalent of Omega (A001222) in the ring of Eisenstein integers.
z is an Eisenstein prime iff z has prime norm or z is the product of a rational prime congruent to 2 modulo 3 and an Eisenstein unit (one of +-1 or (+-1 +- sqrt(3)*i)/2).
The smallest k with a(k) = n is A038754(n).
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Completely additive with a(p) = 2 if p = 3 or p == 1 (mod 3) and a(p) = 1 if p == 2 (mod 3).
example: a(54) = a(2*3^3) = 1*a(2) + 3*a(3) = 1*1 + 3*2 = 7. Over the Gaussian integers, 54 is factored as -2*(1 + w)^6.
a(63) = a(3^2*7) = 2*a(3) + 1*a(7) = 2*2 + 1*2 = 6. Over the Gaussian integers, 63 is factored as w'^2*(1 + w)^4*(2 + w)*(2 + w)'.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := e * If[Mod[p, 3] == 2, 1, 2]; eisBigomega[1] = 0; eisBigomega[n_] := Plus @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[eisBigomega, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 10 2020 *)
xref: Equivalent of arithmetic functions in the ring of Eisenstein integers (the corresponding functions in the ring of integers are in the parentheses): A319442 ("d", A000005), A319449 ("sigma", A000203), A319445 ("phi", A000010), A319446 ("psi", A002322), A319443 ("omega", A001221), this sequence ("Omega", A001222), A319448 ("mu", A008683).
Equivalent in the ring of Gaussian integers: A078458.
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Sep 19 2018
